scale to meet our needs as they change over time so stage maker is actually a built out to be a modular infrastructure
it has three key components the first one is course building so you can use a
pre-built jupiter' notebook so if you go into the stage maker console you can just click start notebook instance and I will open up for

LD ax g boost we have image classification algorithms in there so whenever you're you know tackling that

and tear to that cluster so it ends up residing with some very significant cost savings there and we also recently

there's lots of knobs that you have to twist so the hyper parameter consuming opera algorithm will actually help optimize
that for you so you'll sit in ranges of values that you're really interested in looking at you'll set a budget for how

more optimal model more quickly and finally we have the deployment stage and
this is probably one of my favorite feature because of Amazon stage maker because if anyone had to package a model
before into a container and create an endpoint deployed in the production for folks who have a stronger data science

got to use sage maker the first time and I knew that was it was really that one click right that one line of code and I could have my model package and deploy
it into my environment there's so much easier it was a huge relief in addition to that the deployment stage also has
some really nice features like the ability to do a/b testing so you can actually have up to five different

endpoint auto scaling so whenever it launches at endpoint you can go ahead and set a min and a max amount of ances
